meanings.definition: A sound made by an object falling into water.
meanings.sent1: The stone made a loud kerplunk when it hit the pond.
meanings.sent2: I heard a kerplunk as the pebble dropped into the lake.
meanings.sent3: The frog's kerplunk into the pond startled the ducks nearby.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops made a gentle kerplunk on the surface of the puddle.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman knew he caught a big one when he heard the kerplunk of his line hitting the water.

meanings.definition: To fall or drop suddenly and heavily.
meanings.sent1: The book kerplunked onto the table after slipping from my hands.
meanings.sent2: The apples kerplunked to the ground from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The tired hiker kerplunked onto the soft grass, relieved to rest.
meanings.sent4: The heavy snowflakes kerplunked onto the roof, signaling the start of winter.
meanings.sent5: The old tree finally kerplunked down after years of standing tall in the forest.
